keyword: how many calories in a pizzeria slice of pizza
title: How Many Calories in a Pizzeria Slice of Pizza?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in a pizzeria slice of pizza, including carbs, protein, fat, sodium, and variations for different toppings or crusts.
h1: How Many Calories in a Pizzeria Slice of Pizza?
assumptions: Standard 14-inch cheese pizza, one slice (1/8th of whole), hand-tossed crust, mozzarella cheese, tomato sauce; no extra toppings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by pizzeria, size, crust thickness, cheese amount, and toppings. Check menus or apps for specific values.

quick_answer.text: A typical pizzeria slice of cheese pizza contains about 285 calories and 12 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Extra cheese (1 oz more per slice)

faqs.q: How many calories in a plain cheese pizza slice from a pizzeria?
faqs.a: About 285 kcal for a standard 14-inch slice.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in a pizzeria slice of pizza?
faqs.a: Typically 36 g carbs, including 2 g fiber and 4 g sugars.

faqs.q: Is sodium high in pizzeria pizza slices?
faqs.a: Yes, around 640 mg per slice due to cheese and sauce.

faqs.q: How does crust type affect calories in a pizza slice?
faqs.a: Thin crust reduces calories by ~40 kcal; thick or stuffed adds 50+ kcal.

faqs.q: What toppings increase calories most in a pizzeria slice?
faqs.a: Extra cheese (+80 kcal), pepperoni (+50 kcal), or sausage (+70 kcal) per slice.
